titleStmt.title: Inscription in honour of the praet. prefect Probus from Rome made by the council of Venetia and Histria

summary.term: Honorary inscription for the praetorian prefect Probus

support.rs: yes: later inscription on latus sin.

layout.p: Opistographic: on the opposite field ILBulg I.2, 8b = AE 1927, 45 = AE 1995, 1328 = Lungarova 2012, 136b (discussion in LSA 2596); a sacred dedication in honour of Liber Pater, Conservator of two unnamed Augustus (Valentinian I and Valens), made by Flavius Zosimus, officialis of the province of Asia, promoted primipilarius; cfr. Bresson, Drew-Bear, Zuckemann 1995; Lungarova 2012, 136b. The monument for Diocletian made by the praetorian prefects in 290/291 was reused about 75 years later.

history.provenance: Rome, base of statue engraved on two sides, found in 1742 behind the apse of the church of Trinità de’ Monti.
Seen and verified text by Angius 2020.

div.ab:
Nobilitatis culmini,
litterarum et eloquentiae lumini,
auctoritatis exemplo,
provisionum ac dispositionum magistro,
humanitatis auctori,
moderationis patrono,
devotionis antistiti,
Petronio
Probo viro clarissimo , proconsuli Africae,
praefecto praetorio
per Illyricum, Italiam et Africam,
consuli ordinario,
ob insignia erga se remediorum genera,
Veneti adque Histri peculiares eius
patrono praestantissimo.

Dedicata
VI idus Augustas ,
ddominis nnostris
Valente VI et
Valentiniano II
Auggustis consulibus.

div.p: “To the summit of the nobility, light of letters and eloquence,example of authority, master of foresight and government, promoter of humanity, patron of moderation, high priest of devotion, Petronius Probus, of clarissimus rank, proconsul of Africa, Praetorian Prefect of Illyricum, Italy and Africa, ordinary consul. On account of the extraordinary types of relief shown towards them, by his own men in Venetia and Histria to their most outstanding patron.
Dedicated on August 8th in the sixth consulship of our master Valens Augustus and the second of our master Valentinian Augustus.”

“Sommet de noblesse, phare des lettres et de l’éloquence, modèle d’autorité, maître des mesures et de l’organisation, promoteur du genre humain, champion de la modération, à Petronius Probus, homme très clair, proconsul d’Afrique, préfet du prétoire de l’Italie de illyricum et de l’Afrique, consul ordinaire, pour l’aide extraordinaire qu’il a apportée à eux, les Vénitiens et aux Histri, ses clients particuliers, à leur excellent patron.
Dédiée le sixième jour avant les Ides d’août, pendant le consulat de nos seigneurs Augusti Valens pour la sixième fois et Valentinien pour la deuxième fois.”

“Culmine della nobiltà, faro delle lettere e dell’eloquenza, modello di autorità, maestro dei provvedimenti e dell’organizzazione, promotore del genere umano, campione di moderazione, al chiarissimo Petronius Probus, proncosole d’Africa, prefetto del pretorio di Illirico Italia e Africa, console ordinario, per gli straordinari interventi di aiuto verso di loro, i Veneti e gli Istri, suoi clienti particolari, al loro eccellentissimo patrono.
Dedicata il sesto giorno prima delle idi di agosto, durante il consolato dei nostri signori Augusti Valente per la sesta volta e Valentiniano per la seconda volta.”

The inscription was made by the provincial council of the province of venetia et Histria to their patron, the former praetorian prefect of Italy Illyricum Africa, the very powerful Petronius Probus. His family had extensive properties in the Venetia. The statue was placed by the clients in the atrium of the senator’s domus Pinciana in Rome, complete with the cursus honorum ruled and known up to that date. The explicit date (8th August 378) allows us to establish that at that date Probus had been praetorian prefect only once.
